snippet: A federal judge ruled that the law banning abortions when a fetal heartbeat is detected is invalid and “cannot withstand a constitutional challenge.”
abstract: Federal District Judge Daniel L Hovland overturns North Dakota law banning abortions as early as six weeks into pregnancy and before many women know they are pregnant; rules law banning abortions when fetal heartbeat is detected is invalid, saying it cannot withstand a constitutional challenge.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled that the law banning abortions when a fetal heartbeat is detected is invalid and “cannot withstand a constitutional challenge.”

headline.main: North Dakota: Abortion Ban at 6 Weeks Is Overturned
headline.print_headline: North Dakota: Abortion Ban at 6 Weeks Is Overturned
